intro: Pfeiffera incahuasina, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at elevations between 3,000 and 5,000 meters. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it is often found in alpine meadows and mountainous regions. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
